intro: Hibbertia scabra, commonly known as the rough hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny stems and yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Hibbertia scabra is a shrub that can reach up to 1 meter in height, with narrow, linear leaves. It is often found in heathlands and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
